title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: This section states that this Act shall be called the Indian Penal Code and shall extend to the whole of India except the State of Jammu and Kashmir.
explanation_hi: यह धारा कहती है कि इस अधिनियम को भारतीय दंड संहिता कहा जाएगा और यह जम्मू और कश्मीर राज्य को छोड़कर पूरे भारत में लागू होगी।
examples: ["If an offence occurs in Delhi, IPC applies.", "IPC applies to crimes in Mumbai."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "State of Maharashtra v. XYZ", "summary": "Confirmed applicability of IPC in the entire state including urban and rural areas."}]

title: Punishment of offences committed within India
punishment: As provided for that offence
explanation_en: Every person shall be liable to punishment under this Code and not otherwise for every act or omission contrary to its provisions, committed within India.
explanation_hi: प्रत्येक व्यक्ति इस संहिता के अंतर्गत और इसके अलावा किसी अन्य रूप में नहीं, भारत में किए गए प्रत्येक अपराध या चूक के लिए दंडनीय होगा।
examples: ["A commits theft in India, IPC applies for punishment.", "B assaults C in India, IPC governs the punishment."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "State v. Ram Singh", "summary": "Confirmed IPC applicability for a theft committed in India."}]

title: Punishment of offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within, India
punishment: As provided for that offence
explanation_en: Any person liable by law to be tried for an offence committed beyond India shall be dealt with according to the provisions of this Code for any act committed beyond India as if it had been committed within India.
explanation_hi: जो कोई व्यक्ति भारत के बाहर किए गए अपराध के लिए विधि द्वारा विचारणीय है, वह इस संहिता के अंतर्गत उसी प्रकार दंडनीय होगा जैसे कि वह अपराध भारत में किया गया हो।
examples: ["If an Indian citizen commits murder on a ship registered in India, IPC applies.", "Offences on Indian aircraft can be tried under IPC."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "XYZ v. State of India", "summary": "Clarified IPC applicability for offences committed outside but triable in India."}]

title: Extension of Code to extra-territorial offences
punishment: As provided for that offence
explanation_en: This section extends the application of the IPC to certain offences committed by citizens of India anywhere or on any ship or aircraft registered in India wherever it may be.
explanation_hi: यह धारा भारतीय नागरिकों द्वारा भारत के बाहर या किसी भारतीय जहाज या विमान पर किए गए कुछ अपराधों पर IPC के अनुप्रयोग का विस्तार करती है।
examples: ["An Indian commits theft on a ship registered in India while in international waters.", "An Indian commits an offence on an Indian aircraft."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "ABC v. Union of India", "summary": "Confirmed IPC extension to offences on Indian registered vessels."}]

title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of any special or local law, or any special jurisdiction or power conferred, or any special form of procedure prescribed, by any other law for the time being in force.
explanation_hi: इस अधिनियम की कोई भी बात किसी विशेष या स्थानीय कानून के प्रावधानों, किसी विशेष क्षेत्राधिकार या शक्ति, या किसी अन्य प्रचलित कानून द्वारा निर्धारित किसी विशेष प्रक्रिया को प्रभावित नहीं करेगी।
examples: ["A special state law prescribing a different procedure will not be affected by IPC.", "Local laws on specific crimes remain unaffected."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "State v. DEF", "summary": "Held that IPC does not override special state laws in case of conflict."}]

title: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: This section states that whenever definitions are provided under the IPC, they should be understood in conjunction with any exceptions provided within the Code.
explanation_hi: यह धारा कहती है कि IPC के तहत दी गई परिभाषाओं को कोड में प्रदान की गई किसी भी अपवाद के साथ समझा जाना चाहिए।
examples: ["Understanding 'culpable homicide' under IPC with exceptions provided.", "Reading murder definitions with exceptions."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "GHI v. State", "summary": "Clarified that exceptions must be read with IPC definitions while interpreting sections."}]

title: Sense of expression once explained
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: Every expression which is explained in any part of this Code is used in every part of this Code in conformity with the explanation.
explanation_hi: इस संहिता के किसी भाग में समझाई गई प्रत्येक अभिव्यक्ति का उपयोग संहिता के हर भाग में उसी अर्थ में किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Terms like 'death' or 'injury' carry the same meaning throughout IPC.", "Words explained in definitions apply across the code."]

title: "Gender"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The pronoun 'he' and its derivatives are used for any person, whether male or female.
explanation_hi: 'वह' और इसके व्युत्पन्न शब्द किसी भी व्यक्ति के लिए, चाहे वह पुरुष हो या महिला, उपयोग किए जाते हैं।
examples: ["The term 'he' in IPC sections applies to women as well.", "In interpretation, gender-neutral reading is applied."]

title: "Number"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: Unless the contrary appears, words in singular include the plural, and words in plural include the singular.
explanation_hi: जब तक विपरीत प्रतीत न हो, एकवचन में प्रयुक्त शब्द बहुवचन को भी शामिल करते हैं और बहुवचन में प्रयुक्त शब्द एकवचन को भी।
examples: ["Word 'person' can mean 'persons' and vice versa.", "Reading singular and plural interchangeably in interpretation."]

title: "Man" "Woman"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'Man' denotes a male human being of any age; 'Woman' denotes a female human being of any age.
explanation_hi: 'पुरुष' किसी भी आयु के पुरुष मानव को और 'स्त्री' किसी भी आयु की महिला मानव को दर्शाता है।
examples: ["A boy of 15 is considered a 'man' under IPC.", "A girl of 10 is considered a 'woman' under IPC."]

title: "Person"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'person' includes any Company or Association or body of persons, whether incorporated or not.
explanation_hi: 'व्यक्ति' शब्द में कोई भी कंपनी, संघ या व्यक्तियों का समूह, चाहे वह निगमित हो या नहीं, शामिल होता है।
examples: ["A company can be held liable under IPC.", "An unregistered association can be prosecuted under IPC."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "ABC Corp v. State", "summary": "Held that a company can be considered a 'person' under IPC for certain offences."}]

title: "Public"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'public' includes any class of the public or any community.
explanation_hi: 'सार्वजनिक' शब्द में जनता का कोई भी वर्ग या कोई भी समुदाय शामिल है।
examples: ["A law affecting a village community involves 'public'.", "Disturbance to a section of people is disturbance to 'public'."]

title: "Queen"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'Queen' used in IPC shall be construed to refer to the Sovereign of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
explanation_hi: 'रानी' शब्द का उपयोग IPC में यूनाइटेड किंगडम की महारानी के लिए किया गया है।
examples: ["Historical reference when laws were under British rule."]

title: "Servant of Government"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The words 'servant of Government' denote any officer or servant of the Government, whether remunerated by fees or commission, or not.
explanation_hi: 'सरकारी सेवक' शब्द का अर्थ है सरकार का कोई भी अधिकारी या कर्मचारी, चाहे उसे शुल्क या कमीशन द्वारा पारिश्रमिक दिया गया हो या नहीं।
examples: ["A government clerk is a 'servant of Government' under IPC.", "A police constable is considered a 'servant of Government'."]

title: "Court of Justice"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'Court of Justice' denotes a Judge who is empowered by law to act judicially alone, or a body of Judges which is empowered by law to act judicially as a body, when such Judge or body of Judges is acting judicially.
explanation_hi: 'न्यायालय' का अर्थ है वह न्यायाधीश जिसे अकेले न्यायिक कार्य करने के लिए कानून द्वारा सशक्त किया गया है, या न्यायाधीशों का ऐसा समूह जिसे कानून द्वारा समूह के रूप में न्यायिक कार्य करने के लिए सशक्त किया गया है।
examples: ["A Sessions Court is a 'Court of Justice' under IPC.", "A High Court bench is a 'Court of Justice'."]

title: "Judge"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'Judge' denotes not only every person who is officially designated as a Judge, but also every person who is empowered by law to give, in any legal proceeding, a definitive judgment, or a judgment which, if not appealed against, would be definitive, or a judgment which the party may, in any legal proceeding, submit to, or from which an appeal may be preferred.
explanation_hi: 'न्यायाधीश' शब्द का अर्थ न केवल प्रत्येक व्यक्ति है जिसे आधिकारिक रूप से न्यायाधीश के रूप में नामित किया गया है, बल्कि प्रत्येक व्यक्ति भी है जिसे किसी कानूनी कार्यवाही में निर्णय देने का अधिकार है।
examples: ["A District Judge is a 'Judge' under IPC.", "A Magistrate is considered a 'Judge' while giving decisions."]

title: "Public servant"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The words 'public servant' denote a person falling under any of the descriptions hereinafter following, namely: (including government officers, judges, officers of the court, etc.).
explanation_hi: 'लोक सेवक' शब्द से आशय उन व्यक्तियों से है जो यहाँ पर वर्णित किसी भी श्रेणी में आते हैं जैसे कि सरकारी अधिकारी, न्यायाधीश, अदालत के अधिकारी आदि।
examples: ["A police officer is a 'public servant' under IPC.", "A government clerk falls under 'public servant'."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "State v. XYZ", "summary": "Clarified that a municipal officer is a public servant under IPC."}]

title: "India"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'India' means the territory of India excluding the State of Jammu and Kashmir.
explanation_hi: 'भारत' का अर्थ जम्मू और कश्मीर राज्य को छोड़कर भारत का क्षेत्र है।
examples: ["IPC applies across India except as excluded by law.", "Offences in any Indian state fall under IPC."]

title: "Judge" (additional explanation)
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: Every person who is officially designated as a Judge, or who is empowered by law to give a definitive judgment in any legal proceeding, is a Judge.
explanation_hi: जो कोई व्यक्ति आधिकारिक रूप से न्यायाधीश नामित है या किसी कानूनी कार्यवाही में निर्णय देने के लिए कानून द्वारा सशक्त है, वह न्यायाधीश है।
examples: ["A Sessions Court judge falls under this definition.", "A judicial magistrate giving decisions is a 'Judge'."]

title: "Court of Justice" (additional explanation)
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: A Court of Justice includes every judge or body of judges empowered by law to act judicially.
explanation_hi: न्यायालय में प्रत्येक न्यायाधीश या न्यायाधीशों का वह समूह शामिल है जिसे कानून द्वारा न्यायिक रूप से कार्य करने के लिए सशक्त किया गया है।
examples: ["A High Court is a Court of Justice.", "A Family Court is a Court of Justice under IPC."]

title: "Public servant" (detailed)
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The term 'public servant' includes various categories like government officers, judges, officers of courts, assessors, etc., and includes those remunerated by fees or commission for public duties.
explanation_hi: 'लोक सेवक' में विभिन्न श्रेणियां जैसे सरकारी अधिकारी, न्यायाधीश, अदालत के अधिकारी, मूल्यांकक आदि शामिल हैं, और इसमें वे लोग भी शामिल हैं जिन्हें सार्वजनिक कर्तव्यों के लिए शुल्क या कमीशन द्वारा पारिश्रमिक दिया जाता है।
examples: ["A district magistrate is a 'public servant'.", "An income tax officer is considered a 'public servant'."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "XYZ v. State", "summary": "Held that a Panchayat officer is a 'public servant' under IPC."}]

title: "Movable property"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: "Movable property" is intended to include corporeal property of every description, except land and things attached to the earth or permanently fastened to anything which is attached to the earth.
explanation_hi: 'चल संपत्ति' में हर प्रकार की मूर्त संपत्ति शामिल होती है, भूमि और पृथ्वी से जुड़ी या उससे स्थायी रूप से जुड़ी चीजों को छोड़कर।
examples: ["A mobile phone is 'movable property'.", "A vehicle is considered 'movable property' under IPC."]

title: "Wrongful gain"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'Wrongful gain' means gain by unlawful means of property to which the person gaining is not legally entitled.
explanation_hi: 'अनुचित लाभ' का अर्थ है अवैध तरीकों से उस संपत्ति का लाभ प्राप्त करना, जिसके लिए लाभ प्राप्त करने वाला व्यक्ति कानूनी रूप से अधिकृत नहीं है।
examples: ["Stealing someone\u2019s phone constitutes wrongful gain.", "Receiving stolen property is wrongful gain."]

title: "Dishonestly"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: Whoever does anything with the intention of causing wrongful gain to one person or wrongful loss to another person is said to do that thing 'dishonestly'.
explanation_hi: जो कोई व्यक्ति किसी अन्य को अनुचित लाभ या हानि पहुँचाने के उद्देश्य से कोई कार्य करता है, वह 'बेईमानी' से वह कार्य करता है।
examples: ["Stealing a wallet is done dishonestly.", "Fraudulently selling fake goods is an act done dishonestly."]

title: "Fraudulently"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: A person is said to do a thing fraudulently if he does that thing with intent to defraud but not otherwise.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई व्यक्ति किसी को धोखा देने के उद्देश्य से कोई कार्य करता है, तो कहा जाएगा कि वह कार्य 'धोखाधड़ी से' किया गया है।
examples: ["Creating fake documents to sell property is done fraudulently.", "Signing someone else's cheque to withdraw money is done fraudulently."]

title: "Reason to believe"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: A person is said to have 'reason to believe' a thing if he has sufficient cause to believe that thing but not otherwise.
explanation_hi: यदि किसी व्यक्ति के पास किसी बात पर विश्वास करने का पर्याप्त कारण है, तो कहा जाएगा कि उसके पास उस बात पर 'विश्वास करने का कारण' है।
examples: ["A person accepting a stolen laptop despite knowing its low price may have reason to believe it is stolen.", "Purchasing gold without a bill may give reason to believe it is smuggled."]

title: "Property in possession of wife, clerk or servant"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: When property is in the possession of a person’s wife, clerk, or servant on account of that person, it is considered to be in that person's possession.
explanation_hi: जब कोई संपत्ति किसी व्यक्ति की पत्नी, लिपिक या सेवक के पास उस व्यक्ति के खाते में होती है, तो उसे उस व्यक्ति के कब्जे में माना जाएगा।
examples: ["Money held by a cashier on behalf of the employer is in the employer's possession.", "Jewellery held by wife on behalf of husband is in husband's possession legally."]

title: "Counterfeit"
punishment: Varies by offence
explanation_en: A person is said to 'counterfeit' who causes one thing to resemble another thing, intending by means of that resemblance to practice deception or knowing it to be likely that deception will thereby be practiced.
explanation_hi: जब कोई व्यक्ति एक वस्तु को दूसरी वस्तु की तरह दिखाने के लिए ऐसा करता है, ताकि धोखा देने के उद्देश्य से या यह जानते हुए कि इससे धोखा हो सकता है, तब उसे 'जालसाजी' कहा जाता है।
examples: ["Printing fake currency notes is counterfeiting.", "Making a fake passport to look like a genuine one is counterfeiting."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "State v. XYZ", "summary": "Accused was convicted for counterfeiting currency notes under IPC."}]

title: "Document"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'document' denotes any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters, figures or marks intended to be used, or which may be used, as evidence of that matter.
explanation_hi: 'दस्तावेज़' शब्द का अर्थ है किसी भी वस्तु पर अक्षरों, अंकों या चिह्नों द्वारा व्यक्त या वर्णित किसी भी विषय की वह अभिव्यक्ति जिसका उपयोग साक्ष्य के रूप में किया जा सके।
examples: ["A cheque is a document under IPC.", "A written contract is a document under IPC."]

title: "Valuable security"
punishment: Varies by offence
explanation_en: 'Valuable security' means a document which is or purports to be a document whereby any legal right is created, extended, transferred, restricted, extinguished or released, or whereby any person acknowledges that he lies under legal liability, or has not a certain legal right.
explanation_hi: 'मूल्यवान सुरक्षा' का अर्थ है वह दस्तावेज़ जिसके द्वारा कोई कानूनी अधिकार बनाया, बढ़ाया, स्थानांतरित, सीमित, समाप्त या छोड़ा जाता है।
examples: ["A government bond is a valuable security.", "A registered property sale deed is a valuable security."]

title: "A will"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'will' denotes any testamentary document.
explanation_hi: 'वसीयत' शब्द का अर्थ किसी भी प्रकार का वसीयतनामा दस्तावेज़ होता है।
examples: ["A registered will for property distribution after death.", "A handwritten testament specifying property division."]

title: "Act" and "Omission"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'act' denotes as well a series of acts as a single act, the word 'omission' denotes as well a series of omissions as a single omission.
explanation_hi: 'कृत्य' शब्द का अर्थ एकल कृत्य के साथ-साथ कृत्यों की एक श्रृंखला से भी है, और 'उपेक्षा' शब्द का अर्थ एकल उपेक्षा के साथ-साथ उपेक्षाओं की श्रृंखला से भी है।
examples: ["Failure to pay tax repeatedly is an omission.", "Striking a person repeatedly can be seen as a series of acts."]

title: "Act" "Omission" (additional clarification)
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'act' includes illegal omissions, and the word 'omission' includes illegal acts where context allows.
explanation_hi: 'कृत्य' शब्द में अवैध उपेक्षाएं भी शामिल हैं, और 'उपेक्षा' शब्द में अवैध कृत्य भी संदर्भ के अनुसार शामिल होते हैं।
examples: ["Not providing food to a dependent may be considered an illegal omission.", "An illegal act like assault is covered under 'act'."]

title: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
punishment: Same as offence committed
explanation_en: When a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all, each of such persons is liable for that act in the same manner as if it were done by him alone.
explanation_hi: जब किसी अपराध को कई व्यक्तियों द्वारा समान इरादे से किया जाता है, तो प्रत्येक व्यक्ति उस अपराध के लिए उसी प्रकार उत्तरदायी होता है जैसे कि उसने अकेले किया हो।
examples: ["If A, B, and C beat D with a shared plan, all are equally liable for injuries caused.", "Looting by a group with a common plan makes all equally liable."]
case_refs: [{"case_name": "Mahbub Shah v. King Emperor", "summary": "Clarified that common intention must be proven for joint liability under Section 34 IPC."}]

title: When such an act is criminal by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention
punishment: Same as offence committed
explanation_en: Whenever an act, which is criminal only if done with a criminal knowledge or intention, is done by several persons, each of such persons who joins in the act with such knowledge or intention is liable for the act as if done by him alone with that knowledge or intention.
explanation_hi: जब कोई ऐसा कार्य, जो केवल आपराधिक ज्ञान या इरादे से किया जाने पर अपराध होता है, कई व्यक्तियों द्वारा किया जाता है, तो प्रत्येक व्यक्ति, जो ऐसे ज्ञान या इरादे से उसमें शामिल होता है, उसी प्रकार उत्तरदायी होता है जैसे कि उसने अकेले किया हो।
examples: ["Multiple persons stealing together with the knowledge that it is theft.", "A group knowingly trespassing with criminal intent."]

title: "Effect" caused partly by act and partly by omission
punishment: Same as offence committed
explanation_en: Wherever the causing of a certain effect, or an attempt to cause that effect, by an act or by an omission, is an offence, it is to be understood that the causing of that effect partly by an act and partly by an omission is the same offence.
explanation_hi: जब किसी प्रभाव को किसी कृत्य या उपेक्षा द्वारा उत्पन्न करना या उत्पन्न करने का प्रयास करना अपराध है, तो उसे आंशिक रूप से कृत्य और आंशिक रूप से उपेक्षा द्वारा उत्पन्न करना भी वही अपराध माना जाएगा।
examples: ["Hitting a child (act) and refusing to give food (omission) leading to harm can together be considered in the offence.", "Locking someone in a room and not providing water may involve both act and omission."]

title: Co-operation by doing one of several acts constituting an offence
punishment: Same as offence committed
explanation_en: When an offence is committed by means of several acts, whoever intentionally cooperates in the commission of that offence by doing any one of those acts, either singly or jointly with any other person, commits that offence.
explanation_hi: जब किसी अपराध को कई कृत्यों के माध्यम से किया जाता है, तो जो कोई व्यक्ति उनमें से किसी एक कृत्य को करके जानबूझकर उस अपराध के आयोग में सहयोग करता है, वह उस अपराध को करता है।
examples: ["One person holds the victim while another hits; both are liable.", "In a theft, one distracts while another steals; both commit theft."]

title: Persons concerned in criminal act may be guilty of different offences
punishment: Varies according to individual offence
explanation_en: Where several persons are engaged or concerned in the commission of a criminal act, they may be guilty of different offences by means of that act.
explanation_hi: जब कई व्यक्ति किसी आपराधिक कृत्य के आयोग में संलग्न होते हैं, तो वे उस कृत्य के माध्यम से अलग-अलग अपराधों के लिए दोषी हो सकते हैं।
examples: ["In a riot, one may commit assault while another commits arson; both are liable for their respective offences.", "During a theft, one commits trespass while another commits theft."]

title: "Voluntarily"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: A person is said to cause an effect voluntarily when he causes it by means whereby he intended to cause it, or by means which, at the time of employing those means, he knew or had reason to believe to be likely to cause it.
explanation_hi: जब कोई व्यक्ति किसी प्रभाव को ऐसे साधनों से उत्पन्न करता है जिनसे वह उसे उत्पन्न करना चाहता है, या जिनसे वह उस प्रभाव के उत्पन्न होने की संभावना जानता या मानता है, तब कहा जाता है कि वह व्यक्ति उसे 'स्वेच्छा से' उत्पन्न करता है।
examples: ["Intentionally causing injury by hitting someone is 'voluntarily'.", "Throwing a stone into a crowd knowing it may injure someone is 'voluntarily'."]

title: "Offence"
punishment: Varies with the offence
explanation_en: 'Offence' denotes a thing made punishable by this Code.
explanation_hi: 'अपराध' का अर्थ है वह कार्य जो इस संहिता द्वारा दंडनीय है।
examples: ["Theft is an offence under IPC.", "Murder is an offence under IPC."]

title: "Special law"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'Special law' is a law applicable to a particular subject.
explanation_hi: 'विशेष कानून' का अर्थ है किसी विशेष विषय पर लागू कानून।
examples: ["The NDPS Act is a special law dealing with narcotic drugs.", "The POCSO Act is a special law for child protection."]

title: "Local law"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'Local law' is a law applicable only to a particular part of India.
explanation_hi: 'स्थानीय कानून' का अर्थ है ऐसा कानून जो केवल भारत के किसी विशेष भाग पर लागू होता है।
examples: ["Laws specific to a particular state like land revenue laws.", "Customary laws applicable in a specific region."]

title: "Illegal" "Legally bound to do"
punishment: Context-specific
explanation_en: The word 'illegal' is applicable to everything which is an offence, or which is prohibited by law, or which furnishes ground for a civil action. A person is said to be 'legally bound to do' whatever it is illegal in him to omit.
explanation_hi: 'अवैध' शब्द उन सभी चीजों पर लागू होता है जो अपराध हैं, कानून द्वारा निषिद्ध हैं, या जो नागरिक कार्रवाई का आधार प्रदान करती हैं। किसी व्यक्ति को वह करने के लिए 'कानूनी रूप से बाध्य' माना जाता है, जिसे करना उसकी ओर से छोड़ना अवैध है।
examples: ["Not paying taxes is illegal as one is legally bound to pay.", "Committing theft is illegal under IPC."]

title: "Injury"
punishment: Varies by context
explanation_en: 'Injury' denotes any harm whatever illegally caused to any person, in body, mind, reputation or property.
explanation_hi: 'चोट' का अर्थ है किसी व्यक्ति को उसके शरीर, मन, प्रतिष्ठा या संपत्ति में अवैध रूप से पहुँचाई गई कोई भी हानि।
examples: ["Physical assault causing bodily harm is an injury.", "Defamation causing harm to reputation is an injury under IPC."]

title: "Life"
punishment: Varies by offence
explanation_en: The word 'life' denotes the life of a human being unless the contrary appears from the context.
explanation_hi: 'जीवन' शब्द का अर्थ मनुष्य का जीवन है, जब तक कि संदर्भ से अन्यथा प्रतीत न हो।
examples: ["Murder is an offence against life.", "Causing death by negligence affects life under IPC."]

title: "Death"
punishment: Varies by offence
explanation_en: The word 'death' denotes the death of a human being unless the contrary appears from the context.
explanation_hi: 'मृत्यु' शब्द का अर्थ मनुष्य की मृत्यु है, जब तक कि संदर्भ से अन्यथा न प्रतीत हो।
examples: ["Homicide resulting in death falls under IPC provisions.", "Culpable homicide not amounting to murder still results in death."]

title: "Animal"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'animal' denotes any living creature other than a human being.
explanation_hi: 'पशु' शब्द का अर्थ मनुष्य को छोड़कर कोई भी जीवित प्राणी है।
examples: ["Killing a cow unlawfully is covered under IPC sections relating to animals.", "Cruelty to animals is an offence under related provisions."]

title: "Vessel"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'vessel' denotes anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or of property.
explanation_hi: 'पोत' शब्द का अर्थ पानी द्वारा मनुष्यों या संपत्ति के परिवहन के लिए बनाई गई कोई भी वस्तु है।
examples: ["A ferry used for transport is a vessel under IPC.", "A fishing boat is a vessel under IPC."]

title: "Year" "Month"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: Wherever the word 'year' or 'month' is used, it is to be understood that a year means a year according to the British calendar, and a month means a month according to the British calendar.
explanation_hi: जहाँ कहीं भी 'वर्ष' या 'माह' शब्द का उपयोग किया गया है, वहाँ यह ब्रिटिश कैलेंडर के अनुसार माना जाएगा।
examples: ["A sentence of 1 year means 12 months as per the British calendar.", "Deadlines mentioned in months refer to British calendar months."]

title: "Section"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: The word 'section' denotes one of those portions of a Chapter of this Code which are distinguished by prefixed numeral figures.
explanation_hi: 'धारा' शब्द का अर्थ इस संहिता के अध्याय के उन भागों में से एक है जिन्हें अंकों से अलग किया गया है।
examples: ["Section 302 of IPC relates to murder.", "Section 420 of IPC relates to cheating."]

title: "Oath"
punishment: Context-specific
explanation_en: The word 'oath' includes a solemn affirmation substituted by law for an oath, and any declaration required or authorized by law to be made before a public servant or to be used for the purpose of proof.
explanation_hi: 'शपथ' शब्द में कानून द्वारा शपथ के स्थान पर ली गई गंभीर पुष्टि और कोई भी घोषणा शामिल है जिसे कानून द्वारा सार्वजनिक सेवक के समक्ष या प्रमाण के रूप में उपयोग के लिए आवश्यक या अधिकृत किया गया है।
examples: ["Taking an oath in court before testimony.", "Affirming truth in an affidavit is considered an oath."]

title: "Good faith"
punishment: Context-specific
explanation_en: Nothing is said to be done or believed in 'good faith' which is done or believed without due care and attention.
explanation_hi: जो कार्य या विश्वास उचित देखभाल और ध्यान के बिना किया या माना गया है, उसे 'सद्भावना' में किया या माना नहीं माना जाएगा।
examples: ["A doctor performing surgery carefully even if the patient dies acts in good faith.", "A person reporting a suspected crime with reasonable belief acts in good faith."]

title: "Harbour"
punishment: Context-specific
explanation_en: 'Harbour' includes supplying a person with shelter, food, drink, money, clothes, arms, ammunition or means of conveyance, or assisting a person by any means to evade apprehension.
explanation_hi: 'आश्रय' में किसी व्यक्ति को आश्रय, भोजन, पेय, धन, कपड़े, हथियार, गोला-बारूद या परिवहन के साधन उपलब्ध कराना, या किसी व्यक्ति को गिरफ्तारी से बचने में किसी भी प्रकार से सहायता करना शामिल है।
examples: ["Giving shelter to a fugitive is harbouring under IPC.", "Providing food and hiding a criminal from police is harbouring."]

title: Punishments
punishment: Describes types of punishments under IPC
explanation_en: The punishments to which offenders are liable under IPC are: Death, Imprisonment for Life, Imprisonment (rigorous/simple), Forfeiture of property, and Fine.
explanation_hi: आईपीसी के तहत अपराधियों को जो दंड दिया जा सकता है, वे हैं: मृत्यु, आजीवन कारावास, कारावास (कठोर/साधारण), संपत्ति की जब्ती, और जुर्माना।
examples: ["Murder may attract death or life imprisonment.", "Theft may attract imprisonment or fine."]

title: Commutation of sentence of death
punishment: Allows commutation to other punishments
explanation_en: In every case in which sentence of death has been passed, the appropriate Government may, without the consent of the offender, commute the punishment for any other punishment provided by IPC.
explanation_hi: जिस किसी भी मामले में मृत्यु दंड दिया गया है, उसमें उचित सरकार अपराधी की सहमति के बिना दंड को आईपीसी द्वारा प्रदान किए गए किसी अन्य दंड में परिवर्तित कर सकती है।
examples: ["A death sentence may be commuted to life imprisonment by the state government.", "President's mercy petition may lead to commutation of death penalty."]

title: Commutation of sentence of imprisonment for life
punishment: Allows commutation to a term not exceeding fourteen years
explanation_en: In every case in which a sentence of imprisonment for life has been passed, the appropriate Government may, without the consent of the offender, commute the punishment for imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding fourteen years.
explanation_hi: जिस किसी भी मामले में आजीवन कारावास की सजा दी गई है, उसमें उचित सरकार अपराधी की सहमति के बिना दंड को अधिकतम चौदह वर्षों की अवधि के कारावास में परिवर्तित कर सकती है।
examples: ["State government may reduce a life sentence to 14 years' imprisonment.", "Remission policies may affect the commutation process."]

title: "Appropriate Government"
punishment: N/A
explanation_en: 'Appropriate Government' means the Central Government in cases where the sentence has been passed under laws relating to matters to which the executive power of the Union extends, and in other cases, the State Government.
explanation_hi: 'उचित सरकार' का अर्थ है उन मामलों में केंद्र सरकार जहाँ दंड संघ की कार्यपालिका शक्ति से संबंधित मामलों पर बनाए गए कानूनों के तहत दिया गया है, और अन्य मामलों में राज्य सरकार।
examples: ["For IPC offences under state police jurisdiction, the state government is the appropriate government.", "For offences under central agencies like NIA, the central government is the appropriate government."]

title: Sentence of Europeans and Americans to penal servitude
punishment: No longer applicable (historical context)
explanation_en: This section is omitted as it previously allowed for sentencing Europeans and Americans to penal servitude under IPC, which is now obsolete.
explanation_hi: यह धारा अब हटा दी गई है, जो पहले यूरोपियों और अमेरिकियों को दंड श्रम की सजा देने की अनुमति देती थी, जो अब अप्रचलित है।

title: Fractions of terms of punishment
punishment: Calculation guideline
explanation_en: In calculating fractions of terms of punishment, imprisonment for life shall be reckoned as equivalent to imprisonment for twenty years unless otherwise provided by law.
explanation_hi: दंड की अवधि के अंशों की गणना में, आजीवन कारावास को बीस वर्षों के कारावास के बराबर माना जाएगा जब तक कि कानून में अन्यथा न कहा गया हो।
examples: ["For calculating remission, life imprisonment is considered as 20 years unless specified otherwise."]

title: Offenders sentenced to transportation
punishment: No longer applicable (historical context)
explanation_en: This section is omitted as it previously dealt with offenders sentenced to transportation, which is now obsolete under IPC.
explanation_hi: यह धारा अब हटा दी गई है, जो पहले परिवहन की सजा पाने वाले अपराधियों से संबंधित थी, जो अब आईपीसी के तहत अप्रचलित है।

title: Transportation instead of imprisonment
punishment: No longer applicable (historical context)
explanation_en: This section is omitted as it previously allowed transportation instead of imprisonment, which is now obsolete under IPC.
explanation_hi: यह धारा अब हटा दी गई है, जो पहले कारावास के स्थान पर परिवहन की अनुमति देती थी, जो अब आईपीसी के तहत अप्रचलित है।

title: Sentence may be (in certain cases of imprisonment) wholly or partly rigorous or simple
punishment: Court discretion: rigorous/simple imprisonment
explanation_en: In cases where the punishment is imprisonment and not imprisonment for life, the court may direct that the imprisonment shall be wholly rigorous, or wholly simple, or any part of it rigorous and the rest simple.
explanation_hi: जहाँ दंड कारावास है और आजीवन कारावास नहीं है, वहाँ न्यायालय यह निर्देश दे सकता है कि कारावास पूरी तरह से कठोर, पूरी तरह से साधारण, या आंशिक रूप से कठोर और शेष साधारण होगा।
examples: ["A court may sentence a convict to 2 years, of which 1 year is rigorous and 1 year is simple imprisonment."]

title: Sentence of forfeiture of property
punishment: Repealed (historical context)
explanation_en: This section, which previously allowed the sentence of forfeiture of property as a punishment under IPC, has been repealed.
explanation_hi: यह धारा, जो पहले आईपीसी के तहत संपत्ति की जब्ती की सजा की अनुमति देती थी, अब निरस्त कर दी गई है।

title: Forfeiture of property in respect of offenders punishable with death, transportation or imprisonment
punishment: Repealed (historical context)
explanation_en: This section, which previously allowed forfeiture of property for offenders punishable with death, transportation, or imprisonment, has been repealed.
explanation_hi: यह धारा, जो पहले मृत्यु, परिवहन या कारावास से दंडनीय अपराधियों की संपत्ति की जब्ती की अनुमति देती थी, अब निरस्त कर दी गई है।

title: Amount of fine
punishment: Fine as decided by the court
explanation_en: Where no sum is expressed to which a fine may extend, the amount of fine to which the offender is liable is unlimited, but shall not be excessive.
explanation_hi: जहाँ जुर्माने की राशि निर्धारित नहीं है, वहाँ अपराधी के लिए जुर्माने की राशि असीमित होगी, परंतु अत्यधिक नहीं होगी।
examples: ["If an offence prescribes a fine without a cap, the judge decides a reasonable amount.", "Fine imposed for minor offences under discretion of the court."]

title: Sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
punishment: Imprisonment if fine is not paid
explanation_en: In every case of an offence punishable with imprisonment and fine, in default of payment of the fine, the offender may be imprisoned for a term not exceeding the maximum term provided for the offence.
explanation_hi: हर उस मामले में जहाँ अपराध कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडनीय है, जुर्माने का भुगतान न होने पर अपराधी को उस अपराध के लिए निर्धारित अधिकतम अवधि तक कारावास दिया जा सकता है।
examples: ["If a person fails to pay a fine for theft, they may be imprisoned additionally."]

title: Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine when imprisonment and fine awardable
punishment: Imprisonment up to one-fourth of maximum term for the offence
explanation_en: If an offence is punishable with imprisonment and fine, the imprisonment in default of payment of the fine shall not exceed one-fourth of the maximum term provided for the offence.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई अपराध कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडनीय है, तो जुर्माने का भुगतान न होने पर दी गई कारावास की अवधि उस अपराध के लिए निर्धारित अधिकतम अवधि के एक-चौथाई से अधिक नहीं होगी।
examples: ["If maximum punishment is 4 years, default imprisonment for non-payment of fine cannot exceed 1 year."]

title: Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
punishment: Simple imprisonment unless otherwise specified
explanation_en: The imprisonment which the Court imposes in default of payment of a fine may be of any description to which the offender might have been sentenced for the offence, but if not specified, it shall be simple imprisonment.
explanation_hi: जिस कारावास को न्यायालय जुर्माने के भुगतान न होने की स्थिति में देता है, वह अपराध के लिए दी जाने वाली किसी भी प्रकार की कारावास हो सकती है, लेकिन यदि निर्दिष्ट नहीं है, तो वह साधारण कारावास होगी।
examples: ["If fine for theft is unpaid, the default imprisonment will generally be simple imprisonment unless otherwise specified."]

title: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine when offence punishable with fine only
punishment: Simple imprisonment, up to 2 months if fine not exceeding 50 rupees, 4 months if fine not exceeding 100 rupees, 6 months in other cases
explanation_en: If an offence is punishable with fine only, in default of payment, the imprisonment shall be simple and the term determined based on the fine amount, with limits provided under this section.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई अपराध केवल जुर्माने से दंडनीय है, तो भुगतान न होने की स्थिति में साधारण कारावास दी जाएगी और कारावास की अवधि जुर्माने की राशि के आधार पर इस धारा के तहत निर्धारित की जाएगी।
examples: ["If the fine imposed is 80 rupees and unpaid, simple imprisonment may extend up to 4 months."]

title: Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
punishment: Release upon payment of fine
explanation_en: The imprisonment which is imposed in default of payment of a fine shall terminate whenever that fine is paid or levied by process of law.
explanation_hi: जुर्माने के भुगतान न होने पर दी गई कारावास की अवधि समाप्त हो जाएगी जब वह जुर्माना भुगतान कर दिया जाएगा या कानून की प्रक्रिया द्वारा वसूल लिया जाएगा।
examples: ["If a convict pays the fine during imprisonment, they will be released immediately."]

title: Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
punishment: Release upon payment of proportional fine
explanation_en: If a part of the fine is paid or levied, a proportional part of the imprisonment shall terminate.
explanation_hi: यदि जुर्माने का कोई भाग भुगतान कर दिया जाता है या वसूल लिया जाता है, तो कारावास का आनुपातिक भाग समाप्त हो जाएगा।
examples: ["If half the fine is paid, half of the imprisonment term for non-payment will terminate."]

title: Fine leviable within six years or during imprisonment
punishment: Fine recoverable within six years, or during imprisonment
explanation_en: The fine may be levied at any time within six years after the passing of the sentence, and if the offender is imprisoned for default of payment, it may be levied while he is in prison.
explanation_hi: जुर्माना सजा सुनाए जाने के छह वर्षों के भीतर किसी भी समय वसूला जा सकता है, और यदि अपराधी जुर्माने के भुगतान न करने पर कारावास में है, तो कारावास के दौरान भी वसूला जा सकता है।
examples: ["If a person does not pay the fine, authorities can recover it anytime within 6 years."]

title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
punishment: Cannot exceed punishment for the most severe offence
explanation_en: If an act is made up of parts, each of which is an offence, the offender shall not be punished more than once for the same offence, and the punishment shall not exceed the punishment for the most severe offence.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई कृत्य ऐसे भागों से बना है, जिनमें से प्रत्येक एक अपराध है, तो अपराधी को एक ही अपराध के लिए एक से अधिक बार दंडित नहीं किया जाएगा, और दंड सबसे गंभीर अपराध के लिए निर्धारित दंड से अधिक नहीं होगा।
examples: ["If an act constitutes theft and house trespass, the punishment shall not exceed that for the graver offence."]

title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences, judgment stating offence
punishment: Punishment for the specific offence stated in judgment
explanation_en: If a single act or series of acts is of such a nature that it is doubtful which of several offences the facts constitute, the offender shall be punished for the offence for which he is convicted and sentenced.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई एकल कृत्य या कृत्यों की श्रृंखला इस प्रकार की है कि यह संदेहास्पद है कि तथ्य किस अपराध का गठन करते हैं, तो अपराधी को उस अपराध के लिए दंडित किया जाएगा जिसके लिए उसे दोषी ठहराया गया और दंडित किया गया है।
examples: ["If an act may be cheating or breach of trust, the conviction will specify under which section the punishment is given."]

title: Solitary confinement
punishment: Solitary confinement for certain offences not exceeding 3 months in total
explanation_en: A court may direct solitary confinement for certain offences if the offence is punishable with rigorous imprisonment, but the period shall not exceed three months in total, with limits on continuous solitary confinement.
explanation_hi: यदि अपराध कठोर कारावास से दंडनीय है, तो न्यायालय कुछ अपराधों के लिए एकांत कारावास का निर्देश दे सकता है, परंतु अवधि कुल तीन महीनों से अधिक नहीं होगी, और एकांत कारावास की निरंतर अवधि पर सीमाएं होंगी।
examples: ["A person sentenced to rigorous imprisonment may face solitary confinement as part of punishment within the legal limits."]

title: Limit of solitary confinement
punishment: Not more than 14 days at a time, intervals required
explanation_en: In no case shall solitary confinement exceed fourteen days at a time, and intervals of such confinement shall be provided as specified in the section.
explanation_hi: किसी भी स्थिति में एक बार में एकांत कारावास चौदह दिनों से अधिक नहीं होगा, और इस प्रकार के कारावास की अवधि के बीच अंतराल प्रदान किए जाएंगे।
examples: ["If solitary confinement is imposed, it cannot be for more than 14 days continuously."]

title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences after previous conviction
punishment: Enhanced punishment for repeat offenders
explanation_en: Whoever, having been convicted of an offence punishable with imprisonment of three years or more, is again convicted of an offence punishable with imprisonment of three years or more, shall be liable to enhanced punishment as per law.
explanation_hi: जो कोई, तीन वर्ष या उससे अधिक के कारावास से दंडनीय किसी अपराध के लिए दोषी ठहराया गया हो, और फिर तीन वर्ष या उससे अधिक के कारावास से दंडनीय किसी अपराध के लिए फिर से दोषी ठहराया जाए, वह कानून के अनुसार बढ़े हुए दंड के लिए उत्तरदायी होगा।
examples: ["A thief convicted earlier and again convicted may receive enhanced punishment under IPC."]

title: Act done by a person bound, or by mistake of fact believing himself bound, by law
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is, or who by reason of a mistake of fact and not by reason of a mistake of law in good faith believes himself to be, bound by law to do it.
explanation_hi: जो कोई व्यक्ति, या जो किसी तथ्य के भ्रम के कारण और कानून के भ्रम के कारण नहीं, सद्भावना से स्वयं को कानून द्वारा ऐसा करने के लिए बाध्य मानता है, उसके द्वारा किया गया कार्य अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A soldier firing on orders of a superior officer believing it to be lawful is exempt under this section."]

title: Act of Judge when acting judicially
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by a Judge when acting judicially in the exercise of any power which is, or which in good faith he believes to be, given to him by law.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य न्यायाधीश द्वारा न्यायिक रूप से किसी ऐसी शक्ति का प्रयोग करते हुए किया जाता है, जो उसे कानून द्वारा दी गई है या जो वह सद्भावना से मानता है कि उसे दी गई है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A judge sentencing an accused in court while acting within jurisdiction is exempt under this section."]

title: Act done pursuant to the judgment or order of Court
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing which is done in pursuance of, or which is warranted by the judgment or order of, a Court of justice, if done whilst such judgment or order remains in force, is an offence.
explanation_hi: न्यायालय के निर्णय या आदेश के अनुपालन में या उससे अधिकृत कोई भी कार्य, जब तक ऐसा निर्णय या आदेश प्रभावी है, अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A police officer arresting a person under a court warrant is exempt under this section."]

title: Act done by a person justified, or by mistake of fact believing himself justified, by law
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by any person who is justified by law, or who by reason of a mistake of fact and not by reason of a mistake of law in good faith believes himself to be justified by law, in doing it.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य किसी व्यक्ति द्वारा किया जाता है, जो कानून द्वारा ऐसा करने के लिए अधिकृत है, या जो किसी तथ्य के भ्रम के कारण और कानून के भ्रम के कारण नहीं, सद्भावना से स्वयं को ऐसा करने के लिए अधिकृत मानता है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A person seizing property under a mistaken belief it is stolen, in good faith, is exempt under this section."]

title: Accident in doing a lawful act
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by accident or misfortune, and without any criminal intention or knowledge, in the doing of a lawful act in a lawful manner by lawful means and with proper care and caution.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य किसी वैध कार्य को वैध तरीके से, वैध साधनों से और उचित सावधानी और देखभाल के साथ करते समय दुर्घटना या दुर्भाग्य से, और बिना किसी आपराधिक इरादे या ज्ञान के किया जाता है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A driver accidentally injuring someone despite following traffic rules and care is exempt under this section."]

title: Act likely to cause harm, but done without criminal intent, and to prevent other harm
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence merely by reason of its being done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause harm, if it is done without any criminal intention to cause harm, and in good faith for the purpose of preventing or avoiding other harm to person or property.
explanation_hi: केवल इस कारण से कि कोई कार्य यह जानकर किया गया है कि इससे हानि होने की संभावना है, अपराध नहीं है, यदि यह किसी हानि पहुँचाने के आपराधिक इरादे के बिना और व्यक्ति या संपत्ति को अन्य हानि से बचाने या रोकने के उद्देश्य से सद्भावना में किया गया है।
examples: ["Destroying property to prevent the spread of a fire is exempt under this section."]

title: Act of a child under seven years of age
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by a child under seven years of age.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य सात वर्ष से कम आयु के बच्चे द्वारा किया गया है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A child under seven accidentally causing harm is exempt under this section."]

title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability if lack of sufficient maturity
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by a child above seven years of age and under twelve, who has not attained sufficient maturity of understanding to judge the nature and consequences of his conduct on that occasion.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य सात वर्ष से अधिक और बारह वर्ष से कम आयु के बच्चे द्वारा किया गया है, जिसने उस अवसर पर अपने आचरण की प्रकृति और परिणामों को समझने के लिए पर्याप्त परिपक्वता प्राप्त नहीं की है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A 10-year-old child stealing without understanding its nature may be exempt under this section."]

title: Act of a person of unsound mind
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to law, by reason of unsoundness of mind.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति द्वारा किया गया है, जो उसे करने के समय मानसिक विक्षिप्तता के कारण उसके स्वभाव को जानने में अक्षम है, या यह जानने में अक्षम है कि वह जो कर रहा है वह गलत या कानून के विपरीत है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A person with severe mental illness committing an act without understanding may be exempt under this section."]

title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to law, by reason of intoxication, provided that the thing which intoxicated him was administered to him without his knowledge or against his will.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति द्वारा किया गया है, जो उसे करने के समय मद्यपान के कारण उसके स्वभाव को जानने में अक्षम है, या यह जानने में अक्षम है कि वह जो कर रहा है वह गलत या कानून के विपरीत है, बशर्ते उसे मादक वस्तु उसकी जानकारी के बिना या उसकी इच्छा के विरुद्ध दी गई हो, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A person unknowingly drugged and committing an act without understanding may be exempt under this section."]

title: Offence requiring a particular intent or knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated
punishment: Liable unless intoxication was involuntary
explanation_en: In cases where an act done is not an offence unless done with a particular knowledge or intent, a person who does the act while intoxicated is liable to be treated as if he had the knowledge or intent, unless the intoxicating substance was administered without his knowledge or against his will.
explanation_hi: उन मामलों में जहाँ कोई कार्य किसी विशेष ज्ञान या इरादे के बिना अपराध नहीं है, यदि कोई व्यक्ति उस कार्य को नशे की हालत में करता है, तो उसे ऐसा माना जाएगा कि उसके पास वह ज्ञान या इरादा था, जब तक कि मादक पदार्थ उसकी जानकारी के बिना या उसकी इच्छा के विरुद्ध न दिया गया हो।
examples: ["A person voluntarily intoxicated committing an offence requiring intent will not be exempt."]

title: Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, done by consent
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing which is not intended to cause death, or grievous hurt, and which is not known by the doer to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, or be intended by the doer to cause, to any person above eighteen years of age, who has given consent, whether express or implied, to suffer that harm, or to take the risk of that harm.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य मृत्यु या गंभीर चोट पहुँचाने के इरादे से नहीं किया गया है, और जिसे करने वाला व्यक्ति मृत्यु या गंभीर चोट पहुँचाने की संभावना को नहीं जानता, वह अपराध नहीं है, यदि वह किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति को हानि पहुँचाता है, जिसकी आयु अठारह वर्ष से अधिक है और जिसने उस हानि को सहने या उसके जोखिम को लेने के लिए सहमति दी है।
examples: ["Participants in a boxing match consenting to possible injuries are exempt under this section."]

title: Act not intended to cause death, done by consent in good faith for person's benefit
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing which is done in good faith for the benefit of a person, and which is done with consent, whether express or implied, of that person, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, or be intended by the doer to cause, to that person.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य किसी व्यक्ति के लाभ के लिए सद्भावना से किया गया है, और जो उस व्यक्ति की स्पष्ट या अप्रत्यक्ष सहमति से किया गया है, वह अपराध नहीं है, भले ही उससे उस व्यक्ति को कोई हानि पहुँचती है या करने वाला व्यक्ति उसे पहुँचाने का इरादा रखता है।
examples: ["A surgeon performing surgery with the patient's consent is exempt under this section."]

title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person, by or by consent of guardian
punishment: Exempted with exceptions
explanation_en: Nothing done in good faith for the benefit of a person under twelve years of age, or of unsound mind, by or by consent of the guardian, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, unless it is intended to cause death, or attempted to cause death, or the act is known to be likely to cause death.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य किसी बारह वर्ष से कम आयु के व्यक्ति या मानसिक रूप से विक्षिप्त व्यक्ति के लाभ के लिए, उसके संरक्षक द्वारा या उसकी सहमति से सद्भावना में किया गया है, वह अपराध नहीं है, जब तक कि उसका उद्देश्य मृत्यु पहुँचाना या मृत्यु का प्रयास करना न हो, या ऐसा कार्य मृत्यु पहुँचाने की संभावना के रूप में ज्ञात न हो।
examples: ["A guardian consenting to medical treatment for a child is exempt under this section."]

title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
punishment: Consent invalid if under fear or misconception
explanation_en: Consent given under fear of injury, or under a misconception of fact, is not consent. Consent given by a person under twelve years of age is also not consent under this section.
explanation_hi: जो सहमति किसी चोट के डर से या तथ्य के भ्रम के अधीन दी जाती है, वह सहमति नहीं है। बारह वर्ष से कम आयु के व्यक्ति द्वारा दी गई सहमति भी इस धारा के अंतर्गत सहमति नहीं मानी जाएगी।
examples: ["Consent to a contract given under threat is not valid consent under this section."]

title: Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm caused
punishment: Consent does not excuse certain offences
explanation_en: The exceptions in Sections 87, 88, and 89 do not extend to acts which are offences independently of any harm which they may cause, or be intended to cause, or be known to be likely to cause to the person giving consent, or on whose behalf consent is given.
explanation_hi: धारा 87, 88 और 89 में दिए गए अपवाद उन कार्यों पर लागू नहीं होते जो किसी हानि के बावजूद अपराध हैं, चाहे वह हानि सहमति देने वाले व्यक्ति को पहुँचे या उस व्यक्ति को जिसके लिए सहमति दी गई हो।
examples: ["Consent cannot legalize acts like causing grievous hurt or rape."]

title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent
punishment: Exempted with conditions
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause to a person for whose benefit it is done in good faith, even without that person's consent, if the circumstances are such that it is impossible for that person to signify consent, or if the person is incapable of giving consent, and has no guardian to consent on their behalf.
explanation_hi: यदि परिस्थितियाँ ऐसी हैं कि व्यक्ति अपनी सहमति व्यक्त करने में असमर्थ है, या व्यक्ति सहमति देने में अक्षम है और उसके पास सहमति देने के लिए कोई संरक्षक नहीं है, तो उसके लाभ के लिए सद्भावना से किया गया कोई भी कार्य, चाहे उससे उसे कोई हानि पहुँचे, अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A doctor operating in an emergency without patient consent to save life."]

title: Communication made in good faith
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: No communication made in good faith is an offence by reason of any harm to the person to whom it is made if it is made for the benefit of that person.
explanation_hi: यदि किसी व्यक्ति के लाभ के लिए सद्भावना में कोई संवाद किया गया है, तो उससे उस व्यक्ति को हुई किसी भी हानि के कारण वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A doctor informing a patient of a serious illness in good faith is exempt under this section."]

title: Act to which a person is compelled by threats
punishment: Exempted with exceptions
explanation_en: Except murder and offences against the State punishable with death, nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is compelled to do it by threats which reasonably cause the apprehension that instant death will otherwise be the consequence.
explanation_hi: हत्या और राज्य के विरुद्ध मृत्यु से दंडनीय अपराधों को छोड़कर, कोई भी कार्य जो किसी व्यक्ति द्वारा ऐसे धमकी के कारण किया गया है जिससे यह उचित रूप से भय होता है कि अन्यथा तत्काल मृत्यु हो जाएगी, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A person forced at gunpoint to commit theft may claim exemption under this section."]

title: Act causing slight harm
punishment: No offence due to triviality
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence by reason that it causes, or that it is intended to cause, or that it is known to be likely to cause, any harm, if that harm is so slight that no person of ordinary sense and temper would complain of such harm.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई हानि इतनी तुच्छ है कि कोई सामान्य व्यक्ति उसकी शिकायत नहीं करेगा, तो उससे हुई या जानबूझकर पहुँचाई गई या पहुँचाने की संभावना वाली कोई हानि अपराध नहीं मानी जाएगी।
examples: ["A minor accidental push in a crowded place may not constitute an offence under this section."]

title: Things done in private defence
punishment: Exempted from criminal liability
explanation_en: Nothing is an offence which is done in the exercise of the right of private defence.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कार्य आत्मरक्षा के अधिकार के प्रयोग में किया गया है, वह अपराध नहीं है।
examples: ["A person hitting a thief to prevent theft in self-defence is exempt under this section."]

title: Right of private defence of the body and of property
punishment: Right recognized, not punishable if within limits
explanation_en: Every person has a right, subject to restrictions, to defend their body and the body of any other person against any offence affecting the human body, and to defend property against certain offences including theft, robbery, mischief, or criminal trespass.
explanation_hi: हर व्यक्ति को कुछ प्रतिबंधों के अधीन, अपने शरीर और किसी अन्य व्यक्ति के शरीर की रक्षा करने का अधिकार है, और चोरी, डकैती, शरारत या आपराधिक अतिक्रमण जैसे अपराधों के विरुद्ध संपत्ति की रक्षा करने का अधिकार है।
examples: ["Using reasonable force to prevent a robbery at home is covered under this section."]

title: Right of private defence against the act of a person of unsound mind, etc.
punishment: Right recognized even if aggressor not punishable
explanation_en: When an act, which would otherwise be a certain offence, is not that offence due to the person doing it being of unsound mind or under any other exemption, the right of private defence against such an act still exists.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई कार्य, जो अन्यथा एक अपराध होता, वह इस कारण अपराध नहीं है कि करने वाला व्यक्ति विक्षिप्त है या किसी अन्य अपवाद के अंतर्गत है, तब भी उस कार्य के विरुद्ध आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार बना रहता है।
examples: ["Defending oneself from an insane person attempting to cause harm is permitted under this section."]

title: Acts against which there is no right of private defence
punishment: Defines limits of private defence
explanation_en: No right of private defence exists against an act which does not reasonably cause apprehension of death or grievous hurt, or when there is time to have recourse to the protection of public authorities. The right does not extend to inflicting more harm than necessary.
explanation_hi: ऐसे कार्य के विरुद्ध आत्मरक्षा का कोई अधिकार नहीं है जो मृत्यु या गंभीर चोट का उचित भय उत्पन्न नहीं करता, या जब सार्वजनिक प्राधिकरणों की सुरक्षा प्राप्त करने का समय उपलब्ध हो। यह अधिकार आवश्यक से अधिक हानि पहुँचाने तक विस्तारित नहीं होता।
examples: ["Using excessive force when there is no immediate threat is not protected under this section."]

title: When the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death
punishment: Justified if conditions met
explanation_en: The right of private defence of the body extends to causing death if the assault causes reasonable apprehension of death, grievous hurt, rape, kidnapping, or other severe offences specified under this section.
explanation_hi: यदि आक्रमण मृत्यु, गंभीर चोट, बलात्कार, अपहरण या इस धारा के तहत निर्दिष्ट अन्य गंभीर अपराधों का उचित भय उत्पन्न करता है, तो आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार मृत्यु पहुँचाने तक विस्तारित होता है।
examples: ["Killing an attacker who is attempting to commit rape may be justified under this section."]

title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
punishment: Permits harm other than death if conditions met
explanation_en: If the offence does not reasonably cause apprehension of death or grievous hurt, the right of private defence of the body does not extend to causing death but allows causing other harm to the assailant within reasonable limits.
explanation_hi: यदि अपराध मृत्यु या गंभीर चोट का उचित भय उत्पन्न नहीं करता, तो शरीर की आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार मृत्यु पहुँचाने तक विस्तारित नहीं होता, लेकिन हमलावर को अन्य हानि पहुँचाने की अनुमति देता है।
examples: ["Causing minor injuries to prevent an assault is justified under this section."]

title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body
punishment: Defines start and end of the right
explanation_en: The right of private defence of the body commences as soon as a reasonable apprehension of danger to the body arises and continues as long as such apprehension of danger to the body continues.
explanation_hi: शरीर की आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार जैसे ही शरीर को खतरे का उचित भय उत्पन्न होता है, शुरू होता है और जब तक ऐसा भय बना रहता है, तब तक जारी रहता है।
examples: ["A person can defend himself as long as the threat persists."]

title: When the right of private defence of property extends to causing death
punishment: Permits causing death under specific conditions
explanation_en: The right of private defence of property extends to causing death in cases of robbery, house-breaking by night, mischief by fire on dwelling houses, or theft, mischief, or house-trespass under circumstances that cause reasonable apprehension of death or grievous hurt.
explanation_hi: संपत्ति की आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार डकैती, रात में गृहभेदन, आवास पर आगजनी द्वारा शरारत, या ऐसी परिस्थितियों में चोरी, शरारत या गृह-उल्लंघन के मामलों में मृत्यु पहुँचाने तक विस्तारित होता है, जो मृत्यु या गंभीर चोट का उचित भय उत्पन्न करते हैं।
examples: ["Shooting an armed robber attempting to break into a house at night may be justified under this section."]

title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
punishment: Permits non-fatal harm to protect property
explanation_en: If the offence does not cause reasonable apprehension of death or grievous hurt, the right of private defence of property does not extend to causing death but allows causing other harm to the wrong-doer within reasonable limits.
explanation_hi: यदि अपराध मृत्यु या गंभीर चोट का उचित भय उत्पन्न नहीं करता, तो संपत्ति की आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार मृत्यु पहुँचाने तक विस्तारित नहीं होता, लेकिन गलत करने वाले को अन्य हानि पहुँचाने की अनुमति देता है।
examples: ["Injuring a thief to prevent theft without causing death is allowed under this section."]

title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property
punishment: Defines start and end of the right
explanation_en: The right of private defence of property commences when a reasonable apprehension of danger to the property arises and continues until the wrongful act causing the apprehension ceases or the property has been recovered.
explanation_hi: संपत्ति की आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार तब शुरू होता है जब संपत्ति को खतरे का उचित भय उत्पन्न होता है और तब तक जारी रहता है जब तक गलत कार्य समाप्त नहीं हो जाता या संपत्ति वापस नहीं मिल जाती।
examples: ["Defending property from theft until the thief flees is covered under this section."]

title: Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is risk of harm to innocent person
punishment: Permitted with limitations
explanation_en: If in exercising the right of private defence against an assault which reasonably causes apprehension of death, the defender runs the risk of harming an innocent person, the defender retains the right of defence even at such risk.
explanation_hi: यदि आत्मरक्षा के अधिकार का प्रयोग करते समय, जो मृत्यु का उचित भय उत्पन्न करने वाले आक्रमण के विरुद्ध किया जा रहा है, रक्षक को किसी निर्दोष व्यक्ति को हानि पहुँचाने का जोखिम होता है, तब भी रक्षक को आत्मरक्षा का अधिकार प्राप्त रहता है।
examples: ["Defending against an armed attacker even if there is a risk of harming a bystander."]

title: Abetment of a thing
punishment: Punishable according to offence abetted
explanation_en: A person abets the doing of a thing who instigates, engages in a conspiracy, or intentionally aids the doing of that thing.
explanation_hi: कोई व्यक्ति किसी कार्य के करने में उकसाता है, षड्यंत्र करता है या जानबूझकर सहायता करता है, तो वह उस कार्य का अभिप्रेरक (अबेटर) माना जाता है।
examples: ["Encouraging someone to commit theft constitutes abetment under this section."]

title: Abettor
punishment: Punishable according to offence abetted
explanation_en: A person abets an offence who abets either the commission of an offence or the commission of an act which would be an offence if committed by a person capable by law of committing an offence with the same intention or knowledge.
explanation_hi: कोई व्यक्ति किसी अपराध को, या किसी ऐसे कार्य को, जो अपराध होता यदि वह किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति द्वारा किया गया होता जो उस अपराध को करने में सक्षम होता, उसी इरादे या ज्ञान के साथ उकसाता है, तो वह अभिप्रेरक (अबेटर) होता है।
examples: ["Supplying weapons for use in a robbery is abetment under this section."]

title: Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence and no express provision is made
punishment: Same as offence abetted
explanation_en: If the act abetted is committed in consequence of abetment, and there is no express provision for punishment, the abettor is punished with the punishment provided for the offence.
explanation_hi: यदि अभिप्रेरक के कारण वह कार्य किया जाता है, और उसके लिए कोई विशेष दंड प्रावधान नहीं है, तो अभिप्रेरक को उस अपराध के लिए निर्धारित दंड दिया जाएगा।
examples: ["If a person abets a theft and the theft is committed, the abettor is punished as a thief."]

title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention
punishment: Punishable as if offence was committed
explanation_en: If the person abetted does the act with a different intention or knowledge from that of the abettor, the abettor is liable as if the person had done it with the abettor's intention.
explanation_hi: यदि अभिप्रेरित व्यक्ति वह कार्य अलग इरादे या ज्ञान के साथ करता है, तो अभिप्रेरक ऐसे उत्तरदायी होगा जैसे कि वह कार्य उसके इरादे से किया गया हो।
examples: ["If A abets B to cause hurt, but B causes grievous hurt, A is liable for abetment."]

title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done
punishment: Liable for the act done if probable consequence
explanation_en: When an act is abetted, but a different act is done, the abettor is liable for the act done if it is the probable consequence of the abetment.
explanation_hi: जब किसी कार्य को उकसाया गया है, लेकिन कोई अलग कार्य किया गया है, तो यदि वह कार्य उस अभिप्रेरणा का संभावित परिणाम है, तो अभिप्रेरक उस कार्य के लिए उत्तरदायी होगा।
examples: ["If A instigates B to rob, but B commits murder during the robbery, A may be liable for abetment of murder."]

title: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done
punishment: Cumulative punishment applicable
explanation_en: If the act done is a different offence from the act abetted, the abettor is liable for the act abetted and the act done if it is a probable consequence.
explanation_hi: यदि किया गया कार्य उकसाए गए कार्य से अलग अपराध है, और वह संभावित परिणाम है, तो अभिप्रेरक दोनों कार्यों के लिए उत्तरदायी होगा।
examples: ["If A abets B to commit theft and B commits robbery, A may face punishment for both."]

title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life if offence not committed
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years with fine
explanation_en: If the abetment is of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, and no express provision is made for punishment, the abettor shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine if the offence is not committed.
explanation_hi: यदि किसी अपराध, जो मृत्यु या आजीवन कारावास से दंडनीय है, की अभिप्रेरणा की जाती है, और कोई विशेष दंड प्रावधान नहीं है, तथा अपराध नहीं होता है, तो अभिप्रेरक को 7 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["If A abets B to commit murder and B does not commit it, A can still be punished."]

title: Abettor present when offence is committed
punishment: Treated as principal offender
explanation_en: When the abettor is present at the time of the commission of the offence, they are treated as if they themselves committed the offence.
explanation_hi: जब अभिप्रेरक अपराध के समय उपस्थित होता है, तो उसे ऐसा माना जाएगा जैसे उसने स्वयं अपराध किया हो।
examples: ["If A instigates B to steal and is present during the theft, A is treated as if he committed theft."]

title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life if offence not committed
punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment with fine; if act causes hurt, up to life imprisonment
explanation_en: If a person abets an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment, but the offence is not committed, the abettor shall be punished with up to 7 years imprisonment and fine. If any act done in consequence of the abetment causes hurt, the abettor can face life imprisonment.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई व्यक्ति किसी अपराध, जो मृत्यु या आजीवन कारावास से दंडनीय है, की अभिप्रेरणा करता है, लेकिन अपराध नहीं होता है, तो अभिप्रेरक को 7 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा। यदि उस अभिप्रेरणा के परिणामस्वरूप कोई कार्य किसी को चोट पहुँचाता है, तो अभिप्रेरक को आजीवन कारावास भी हो सकता है।
examples: ["If A abets B to commit murder, but B does not commit it, A can be punished under this section."]

title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment if offence not committed
punishment: Punishable with one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both
explanation_en: If a person abets an offence punishable with imprisonment, and the offence is not committed in consequence, and there is no express provision for punishment, the abettor is punishable with imprisonment up to one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or with fine, or both.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई व्यक्ति किसी अपराध, जो कारावास से दंडनीय है, की अभिप्रेरणा करता है, और उस अपराध के परिणामस्वरूप अपराध नहीं होता है, तथा कोई विशेष दंड प्रावधान नहीं है, तो अभिप्रेरक को उस अपराध के लिए निर्धारित अधिकतम अवधि के एक-चौथाई तक के कारावास, या जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["If A abets B to commit theft, but B does not commit it, A can still be punished under this section."]

title: Abetting commission of offence by the public or by more than ten persons
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both
explanation_en: Whoever abets the commission of an offence by the public generally or by any number or class of persons exceeding ten is punishable with imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
explanation_hi: जो कोई जनता या दस से अधिक व्यक्तियों की किसी संख्या या वर्ग द्वारा किसी अपराध के किए जाने की अभिप्रेरणा करता है, वह 3 वर्ष तक के कारावास, या जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडनीय होगा।
examples: ["Inciting a mob to commit violence is punishable under this section."]

title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both
explanation_en: Whoever intending to facilitate or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby facilitate the commission of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, voluntarily conceals by any act or illegal omission the existence of a design to commit such offence, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both.
explanation_hi: जो कोई मृत्यु या आजीवन कारावास से दंडनीय अपराध के किए जाने की योजना को जानबूझकर छुपाता है, जिससे उस अपराध के किए जाने की संभावना बढ़ जाती है, वह 7 वर्ष तक के कारावास, या जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडनीय होगा।
examples: ["Hiding information about a planned murder is punishable under this section."]

title: Public servant concealing design to commit offence which it is his duty to prevent
punishment: If offence is committed, imprisonment up to 7 years; if not, up to 2 years or fine, or both
explanation_en: A public servant who intending to facilitate or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby facilitate the commission of an offence which it is his duty to prevent, voluntarily conceals by any act or omission the existence of a design to commit such offence, shall be punished accordingly.
explanation_hi: यदि कोई लोक सेवक किसी अपराध के किए जाने की योजना को, जिसे रोकना उसका कर्तव्य है, जानबूझकर छुपाता है, तो यदि अपराध हो जाता है तो उसे 7 वर्ष तक का कारावास और यदि अपराध नहीं होता है तो उसे 2 वर्ष तक का कारावास, या जुर्माना, या दोनों से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["A police officer hiding information about an impending robbery is punishable under this section."]

title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1/4 of longest term provided for offence, or fine, or both
explanation_en: Whoever intending to facilitate or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby facilitate the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment, voluntarily conceals by any act or omission the existence of a design to commit such offence, shall, if the offence is committed, be punished with imprisonment up to one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence; if the offence is not committed, he shall be punished with imprisonment up to one-eighth of the longest term, or fine, or both.
explanation_hi: जो कोई कारावास से दंडनीय अपराध के किए जाने की योजना को जानबूझकर छुपाता है, यदि अपराध हो जाता है तो उसे उस अपराध के लिए निर्धारित अधिकतम अवधि के एक-चौथाई तक के कारावास से, और यदि अपराध नहीं होता है तो अधिकतम अवधि के एक-आठवें तक के कारावास, या जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Concealing plans of a theft by another person is punishable under this section."]

title: Definition of criminal conspiracy
punishment: Punishable according to nature of offence planned
explanation_en: When two or more persons agree to do, or cause to be done, an illegal act, or a legal act by illegal means, such an agreement is designated a criminal conspiracy.
explanation_hi: जब दो या अधिक व्यक्ति किसी अवैध कार्य को करने या कराने के लिए, या किसी वैध कार्य को अवैध तरीकों से करने के लिए सहमत होते हैं, तो ऐसी सहमति को आपराधिक षड्यंत्र कहा जाता है।
examples: ["Two people agreeing to commit a robbery is a criminal conspiracy."]

title: Punishment of criminal conspiracy
punishment: Punished as per nature of offence; for others, imprisonment up to 6 months or fine, or both
explanation_en: Whoever is a party to a criminal conspiracy to commit an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for two years or upwards shall be punished in the same manner as if he had abetted such offence. In other cases, shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or with both.
explanation_hi: जो कोई मृत्यु, आजीवन कारावास, या दो वर्ष या उससे अधिक कठोर कारावास से दंडनीय अपराध करने के लिए आपराधिक षड्यंत्र का पक्षकार है, उसे उसी प्रकार दंडित किया जाएगा जैसे उसने उस अपराध की अभिप्रेरणा की हो। अन्य मामलों में, उसे छह माह तक के कारावास, या जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["A group planning to commit murder will be punished under this section."]

title: Waging, or attempting to wage war, or abetting waging of war, against the Government of India
punishment: Punishable with death or imprisonment for life and fine
explanation_en: Whoever wages war against the Government of India, or attempts to wage such war, or abets the waging of such war, shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life and shall also be liable to fine.
explanation_hi: जो कोई भारत सरकार के विरुद्ध युद्ध करता है, या करने का प्रयास करता है, या ऐसे युद्ध करने की अभिप्रेरणा करता है, उसे मृत्यु या आजीवन कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Joining a militant group to wage war against India falls under this section."]

title: Conspiracy to commit offences punishable by Section 121
punishment: Imprisonment for life or up to 10 years with fine
explanation_en: Whoever within or without India conspires to commit any of the offences punishable by Section 121, or to deprive the Government of India of the sovereignty of any part of its territory, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.
explanation_hi: जो कोई भारत के भीतर या बाहर, धारा 121 से दंडनीय किसी अपराध को करने की या भारत सरकार को उसके किसी भाग के क्षेत्राधिकार से वंचित करने की षड्यंत्र करता है, उसे आजीवन कारावास या 10 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Planning with others to start a war against India comes under this section."]

title: Collecting arms, etc., with intention of waging war against the Government of India
punishment: Imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine
explanation_en: Whoever collects men, arms, or ammunition or otherwise prepares to wage war with the intention of waging or being prepared to wage war against the Government of India shall be punished with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.
explanation_hi: जो कोई पुरुषों, हथियारों या गोला-बारूद को एकत्र करता है या अन्यथा भारत सरकार के विरुद्ध युद्ध करने या युद्ध करने की तैयारी करने के इरादे से तैयार करता है, उसे आजीवन कारावास या 10 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Secretly gathering weapons to fight the Government of India falls under this section."]

title: Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine
explanation_en: Whoever, by any act or illegal omission, conceals the existence of a design to wage war against the Government of India, intending by such concealment to facilitate, or knowing it to be likely that such concealment will facilitate, the waging of such war, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.
explanation_hi: जो कोई भारत सरकार के विरुद्ध युद्ध करने की योजना के अस्तित्व को छुपाता है, और ऐसा करने का उद्देश्य उस युद्ध को सुविधाजनक बनाना है या यह जानता है कि ऐसा छुपाना उस युद्ध को सुविधाजनक बना सकता है, तो उसे 10 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Hiding information about a planned armed rebellion against the Government of India falls under this section."]

title: Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of any lawful power
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine
explanation_en: Whoever, with the intention of inducing or compelling the President of India or the Governor of any State to exercise or refrain from exercising in any manner any of the lawful powers of such office, assaults or wrongfully restrains, or attempts to assault or wrongfully restrain, or overawes by means of criminal force or the show of criminal force, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.
explanation_hi: जो कोई राष्ट्रपति या किसी राज्य के राज्यपाल को किसी वैध शक्ति का प्रयोग करने या न करने के लिए प्रेरित या बाध्य करने के उद्देश्य से हमला करता है, गलत तरीके से रोकता है, या ऐसा करने का प्रयास करता है, या आपराधिक बल के माध्यम से भयभीत करता है, तो उसे 7 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Physically attacking a Governor to force a decision comes under this section."]

title: Sedition
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or up to 3 years with fine
explanation_en: Whoever, by words, spoken or written, or by signs, or by visible representation, or otherwise, brings or attempts to bring into hatred or contempt, or excites or attempts to excite disaffection towards the Government established by law in India, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to 3 years, to which fine may be added.
explanation_hi: जो कोई शब्दों, संकेतों या दृश्य प्रतिनिधित्व आदि के माध्यम से भारत में विधि द्वारा स्थापित सरकार के प्रति घृणा या अवमानना उत्पन्न करता है या उत्पन्न करने का प्रयास करता है, या असंतोष भड़काता है या भड़काने का प्रयास करता है, उसे आजीवन कारावास या 3 वर्ष तक के कारावास और जुर्माने से दंडित किया जाएगा।
examples: ["Inciting violence against the Government through speeches is punishable under this section."]

title: Waging war against any Asiatic Power in alliance with the Government of India
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or up to 7 years and fine
